thinking.disposable_income: Midtown residents have relatively high disposable incomes with a median household income around $87,000, significantly above Houston's average.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: As a young professional-dominated area with many dining, entertainment, and retail options, Midtown residents tend to have high discretionary spending on lifestyle amenities.
thinking.accessibility: Midtown has excellent multi-modal transportation access with MetroRail, frequent bus service, walkable streets, and good road connectivity to downtown and other major employment centers.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Given high incomes, residents can absorb moderate fees/taxes while valuing time savings 2) Strong existing transit infrastructure means improvements will be well-utilized 3) Dense, mixed-use character makes transit viable primary mode 4) Young professional demographic likely to embrace transit if service quality high 5) Ranking prioritizes proposals with moderate-to-high funding (1-1.5% tax) and lower transit fares to encourage ridership 6) Driver fees included to manage congestion and fund improvements 7) Selected proposals balance travel time improvements with reasonable cost increases
